intro: Strobilanthes lurida var. bourneae, commonly known as the Bornean strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid tropical climates. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
